caption.p:
S − P patterns obtained from the NCEP reanalysis data ( a) and the simulations of the 15 models ( b– p). Two groups (“Normal” and “ENSO”) were classified according to Nino3.4 index. The vertical dashed line represents the percolation threshold ( P
c = 0.48) determined from the reanalysis data. The color depicts the probability for a given point of each sub-figure to have a pair of S and P. The numbers marked in the color bar are transformed by log10. As one can see, most models missed the correct percolation phase transition.
